thread.title: Three Dash players called into USWNT SheBelieves Cup training camp
thread.title_full: Three Dash players called into USWNT SheBelieves Cup training camp

author: Corey Roepken
title: Three Dash players called into USWNT SheBelieves Cup training camp
text:
Close Image 1 of 3 USA's Carli Lloyd (10) celebrates after beating Netherlands goal keeper Sari van Veenendaal for a goal in the first half of an exhibition soccer match, Sunday, Sept. 18, 2016, in Atlanta. (AP Photo/John Bazemore) less USA's Carli Lloyd (10) celebrates after beating Netherlands goal keeper Sari van Veenendaal for a goal in the first half of an exhibition soccer match, Sunday, Sept. 18, 2016, in Atlanta. (AP Photo/John ... more Photo: John Bazemore, STF Image 2 of 3 Houston Dash midfielder Morgan Brian (6) head butts the ball away from FC Kansas City defender Brittany Taylor (13) from scoring during the first half of action between the Houston Dash and the FC Kansas City during a soccer game at BBVA Compass, Sunday, June 19, 2016, in Houston. less Houston Dash midfielder Morgan Brian (6) head butts the ball away from FC Kansas City defender Brittany Taylor (13) from scoring during the first half of action between the Houston Dash and the FC Kansas City ... more Photo: Juan DeLeon, FRE Image 3 of 3 Jane Campbell, Stanford Cardinals goalkepper, kicks the ball as the Stanford Cardinals play the California Golden Bears on Friday, November 4, 2016 in Berkeley, Calif. Jane Campbell, Stanford Cardinals goalkepper, kicks the ball as the Stanford Cardinals play the California Golden Bears on Friday, November 4, 2016 in Berkeley, Calif. Photo: Lea Suzuki, The Chronicle Three Dash players called into USWNT SheBelieves Cup training camp 1 / 3 Back to Gallery 
Three Dash players, including two-time reigning FIFA Women's Player of the Year Carli Lloyd, are on the USWNT roster for next month's SheBelieves Cup, which will pit four of the world's top five teams against one another. 
Lloyd will be joined by midfielder Morgan Brian and rookie goalkeeper Jane Campbell. Together they will be part of the 25-player training camp roster that will represent the United States in matches against Germany, England and France. 
At the conclusion of camp, head coach Jill Ellis will name a 23-player roster for the tournament. 
"January gave us a chance to see some new faces in with the veterans, and get some quality time on the training field," Ellis said. "A player's performance in that camp and positional depth guided our selection for this pre-camp, and from here we will select our SheBelieves Cup roster. There will be no better test than opening against Germany, so we will need to have a laser focus as soon as we land in Orlando. As our players have not yet returned to their clubs, they have been training in their independent environments, so playing as much 11v11 situations will again be critical during these few days." 
The round-robin tournament will be played on March 1, 4 and 7 as three doubleheaders in the same stadiums. It is the most prestigious tournament the USWNT will play this year. It won the title in last year's inaugural edition. 
The USWNT will face Germany at Talon Energy Stadium in Chester, Pa., on March 1. On March 4, the USWNT will face England at Red Bull Arena in Harrison, N.J. The finale will be on March 7 against France at RFK Stadium in Washington, D.C. 
Lloyd and Brian are regulars with the USWNT and both played on the 2015 FIFA Women's World Cup championship team. Lloyd, who in January was named the world player of the year for the second year in a row, has 232 caps and 96 goals. Brian has six goals in 63 appearances. 
Campbell, a Stanford product, has never appeared in a game for the USWNT but is viewed as one of the country's up-and-coming goalkeepers. Dash coach Randy Waldrum already had two goalkeepers on his roster but picked her in the second round of January's NWSL Draft because he said her potential is too good to pass up. More Information 
March 1 at Talon Energy Stadium; Chester, Pa. 3 p.m.: England vs France 6 p.m.: United States vs. Germany (FS1) March 4 at Red Bull Arena; Harrison, N.J. 1:15 p.m.: France vs. Germany 4:15 p.m.: United States vs. England. March 7 at RFK Stadium; Washington, D.C. 3 p.m.: Germany vs. England 6 p.m.: United States vs. France 
Full USWNT roster Goalkeepers (3): Jane Campbell (Houston Dash), Ashlyn Harris (Orlando Pride), Alyssa Naeher (Chicago Red Stars) Defenders (7): Julie Johnston (Chicago Red Stars), Megan Klingenberg (Portland Thorns FC), Ali Krieger (Orlando Pride), Kelley O'Hara (Sky Blue FC), Becky Sauerbrunn (FC Kansas City), Casey Short (Chicago Red Stars), Emily Sonnett (Portland Thorns FC) Midfielders (9): Morgan Brian (Houston Dash), Tobin Heath (Portland Thorns FC), Lindsey Horan (Portland Thorns FC), Sarah Killion (Sky Blue FC), Rose Lavelle (Boston Breakers), Carli Lloyd (Houston Dash), Allie Long (Portland Thorns FC), Samantha Mewis (NC Courage), Brianna Pinto (CASL) Forwards (6): Crystal Dunn (Chelsea Ladies FC), Alex Morgan (Olympique Lyonnais), Christen Press (Chicago Red Stars), Mallory Pugh (UCLA), Amy Rodriguez (FC Kansas City), Lynn Williams (NC Courage)
